title: Expert Training Course for Designing Early Childhood Programming Education

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental programming concepts and introduction to educational theory
context.additional_context: Practical curriculum for university students and job seekers to strengthen competencies in designing early childhood programming education. Aims to cultivate immediately applicable expertise in educational settings through project development experiences using the ScratchJr platform

learning_goals: Explain core programming concepts (repetition, conditional statements, event handling) required for designing programming education for young children
Design and implement at least five age-appropriate creative projects using the ScratchJr tool
Applying the Project-Based Learning (PBL) methodology, one can fully develop a single early childhood programming curriculum.
Through learner artifact analysis, a system can be established to evaluate early childhood programming utilization patterns.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
